text: Ipanema Atlético Clube, commonly known as Ipanema, is a Brazilian football club based in Santana do Ipanema, Alagoas state. ==History== The club was founded on May 5, 1923, as Ipanema Sport Club, eventually being renamed to Ipanema Atlético Clube. Ipanema lost the 1992 Campeonato Alagoano to CRB. ==Stadium== Ipanema Atlético Clube play their home games at Estádio Governador Arnon de Melo. The stadium has a maximum capacity of 6,000 people. ==Honours== *Campeonato Alagoano Second Division: 1989, 2014 ==References== Category:Association football clubs established in 1923 Category:Football clubs in Alagoas Category:1923 establishments in Brazil
title: Ipanema Atlético Clube
